intro: Neoraimondia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian sarsapilla, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are typically followed by follicle fruits. It is often found in dry to moist habitats, including forests and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
